main_definition: Digital Video Disc (DVD) is a type of optical disc storage medium used to store digital data, including movies, music, software, and other multimedia content.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A compact disc designed for storing digital video files
meanings_and_examples.example: The latest action movie is available on DVD format.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An optical storage medium used to store and playback audio-visual content
meanings_and_examples.example: I borrowed my friend's DVD player to watch a classic film in its original format.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A data transfer method that uses laser technology to read and write information on an optical disc
meanings_and_examples.example: To update the software, I burned a new DVD with the latest version of the program.
